Law & Policy




 

Stanford Law School — April 26, 2023
A new vision of Native people’s contributions to Constitutional law
You may have given little thought to the role Native Americans played in the creation of the U.S. Constitution. But SLS scholars argue that Native people profoundly shaped the conversation.
Read More




 

Stanford Law School — April 13, 2023
Report on advancing climate-smart agriculture urges better data practices
A new report emphasizes the need for precise, practical protocols for measuring the climate benefits associated with agricultural practices.
Read More




 

Stanford Law School — February 24, 2023
Law clinic trains youth and education advocates
Students in the Youth and Education Law Project hone their research and advocacy skills by helping kids facing disciplinary action or seeking accommodations.
Read More




 

Stanford HAI — January 31, 2023
Study finds IRS disproportionately audits Black taxpayers
A Stanford collaboration with the Department of the Treasury yields the first direct evidence of differences in audit rates by race.
Read More




 

Stanford Law School — January 20, 2023
Scholars comment on 50th anniversary of Roe v. Wade
The decision in Roe v. Wade came on Jan. 22, 1973. Stanford Law faculty provide commentary on the Supreme Court’s decision, and the one that overturned it in June 2022.
Read More




 

Stanford Law School — January 18, 2023
Stanford Law’s David Sklansky weighs in on Biden documents
Stanford Law’s David Sklansky offers perspective on the special counsel investigation of President Biden’s possession of documents from his service in the Obama administration.
Read More




 

Stanford Law School — December 14, 2022
Insights on marriage equality legislation
Stanford Law’s Jane Schacter, a scholar of constitutional law, discusses the Respect for Marriage Act signed by President Biden
Read More
